jd_format.value:
Job Title

HR Business Partner

Job Code

HRBP-001

Overview

As an HR Business Partner at Humble Bridge, you will play a pivotal role in aligning our HR strategy with business objectives. You will be responsible for strategic workforce planning, leadership coaching, and optimizing employee experience. Your expertise in HR management and knowledge of Austrian labor law will be crucial in driving organizational success.

Company Overview

Humble Bridge is a leading AI/ML company dedicated to driving digital transformation across various industries. We pride ourselves on our innovative solutions and commitment to excellence.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the overall business strategy.
  • Manage workforce planning and succession planning.
  • Provide leadership coaching and support.
  • Enhance employee experience and engagement.
  • Ensure compliance with Austrian labor laws.
  • Facilitate organizational design and change management initiatives.
  • Assist in the development of HR policies and procedures.
  • Support recruitment and onboarding processes.

Requirements

  • Degree in Business Administration, Psychology, International Cultural and Business Studies, or related field.
  • Advanced degree in HR or related field is a plus.
  • 5 years of experience.
  • HR certification such as SHRM-CP or PHR is preferred.
  • Fluent in English (business), conversational in German.
  • Must have legal authorization to work in Austria.

Skills

  • General knowledge of HR practices and Austrian labor law. Familiarity with Microsoft Office and/or Google Workspace.
  • Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Experience with HRIS systems.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment.

Compensation and Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience.
  • Performance-based bonuses.
  • Comprehensive health insurance, paid time off, and retirement benefits.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development in a dynamic and innovative environment.

Entry

Immediate availability preferred.

Company Info

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by sending their resume and cover letter to careers@humblebridge.com.

Address: Humble Bridge, 123 Innovation Drive, Vienna, Austria.

Application Instructions

Submit your application through our careers page or email your resume and cover letter to careers@humblebridge.com.

Reporting Line

Reports to the Director of Human Resources.

Measures of Outcome

Successful implementation of HR strategies, improved employee engagement scores, and effective leadership development programs.

Work Environment

  • Standard business hours with flexibility for remote work.
  • Minimal travel required.
  • Full-time
  • Hybrid - Vienna, Austria
  • Permanent
  • Primarily a desk-based role with occasional meetings.

No. of Openings

1

Industry Type

AI/ML, Technology

Department

Human Resources

Application Deadline

2023-11-15

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

Humble Bridge is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Diversity and Inclusion Statement

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion to drive innovation and success. Our team is committed to fostering a culture where everyone feels valued and respected.

Interview Rounds

The interview process includes an initial phone screening, followed by a panel interview and a final interview with the HR Director.

Level

Mid-level
